commented_code:
## Tests
 
-You can run the test suite either using `bun test <path>`, or by using the wrapper script `packages\bun-internal-test`. The internal test package is a wrapper cli to run every test file in a separate instance of bun.exe, to prevent a crash in the test runner from stopping the entire suite.
+You can run the test suite either using `bun test <path>` or by using the wrapper script `bun node:test <path>`. The internal test package is a wrapper cli to run every test file in a separate instance of bun.exe, to prevent a crash in the test runner from stopping the entire suite.

discussion_comments.commented_code:

 ## Tests
 
-You can run the test suite either using `bun test <path>`, or by using the wrapper script `packages\bun-internal-test`. The internal test package is a wrapper cli to run every test file in a separate instance of bun.exe, to prevent a crash in the test runner from stopping the entire suite.
+You can run the test suite either using `bun test <path>` or by using the wrapper script `bun node:test <path>`. The internal test package is a wrapper cli to run every test file in a separate instance of bun.exe, to prevent a crash in the test runner from stopping the entire suite.
discussion_comments.comment_body:
The documentation still references "The internal test package" which has been deleted in this PR. This creates confusion since the package no longer exists. Consider updating this sentence to remove the reference to the deleted package or rewrite it to accurately describe the current testing approach using `bun test` and `bun node:test`. ```suggestion You can run the test suite either using `bun test ` or by using the wrapper script `bun node:test `. The `bun node:test` command runs every test file in a separate instance of bun.exe, to prevent a crash in the test runner from stopping the entire suite. ``` *Spotted by [Diamond](https://app.graphite.dev/diamond/?org=oven-sh&ref=ai-review-comment)*

commented_code:
+# Bun
+
+This is the Linux x64 binary for Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. https://bun.com

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+# Bun
+
+This is the Linux x64 binary for Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. https://bun.com
discussion_comments.comment_body:
There appears to be an architecture mismatch in the README. The package is for `bun-linux-aarch64-musl` (ARM64 architecture), but the README text incorrectly states "Linux x64 binary" instead of "Linux arm64 binary". Linux-aarch64 packages should reference ARM64 architecture in their documentation for accuracy. ```diff - This is the Linux x64 binary for Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. https://bun.com + This is the Linux arm64 binary for Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. https://bun.com ``` ```suggestion This is the Linux arm64 binary for Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. https://bun.com ``` *Spotted by [Diamond](https://app.graphite.dev/diamond/?org=oven-sh&ref=ai-review-comment)*
